articles.title: Nikola Jokić exits Monday game with left knee injury - NBA
articles.description: Nikola Jokić limps off the court in Miami on Monday night after appearing to hurt his left knee just before halftime.

articles.description: Atlanta won its third straight game, while Los Angeles has lost back-to-back contests

articles.title: Bangladesh's first female prime minister Khaleda Zia dies aged 80 - BBC
articles.description: Zia became the country's first female leader in 1991 after its first democratic election in 20 years.

articles.title: Trump says he might sue Fed Chair Jerome Powell for ‘gross incompetence’ - The Washington Post
articles.description: It isn’t clear what specific claims could be brought against Powell or when.

articles.title: How a viral video prompted investigations into alleged fraud at day care centers in Minnesota - CBS News
articles.description: While many of the Minnesota day care centers in the video were cited and fined for safety violations, investigators previously found no evidence of fraud.

articles.title: Trump threatens strikes against Iran if it restarts nuclear programme - Financial Times
articles.description: US president warns Hamas it has a ‘very short period of time to disarm’ after talks with Israeli leader Benjamin Netanyahu

articles.title: Takeaways from Trump and Netanyahu’s meeting in Florida - CNN
articles.description: President Donald Trump’s Monday meeting in Florida at Mar-a-Lago with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu generated plenty of warm words — but no clear progress in their peace plan for Gaza.

articles.title: Trump administration rolls out rural health funding, with strings attached - PBS
articles.description: While every state applied for money from the Rural Health Transformation Program, it won't be distributed equally. And critics worry that the funding might be pulled back if a state's policies don't match up with the administration's.

articles.title: Trump says U.S. destroyed loading dock in Venezuela - The Washington Post
articles.description: Trump would not say whether the military or the CIA conducted the strike in Venezuela amid escalating U.S. pressure on Nicolás Maduro.

articles.title: News & Notes: Lamar Jackson's Status Undetermined, But There's Optimism - Ravens Home | Baltimore Ravens – baltimoreravens.com
articles.description: Harbaugh has ‘no headspace’ for head coach battle narrative. Ravens’ plan was to ‘ramp up’ Derrick Henry’s usage. Harbaugh pinpoints problems with Ravens’ pass defense in Green Bay.

articles.title: Israeli recognition of Somaliland prompts global outcry, emergency U.N. meeting - The Washington Post
articles.description: Israel’s diplomatic move makes it an outlier in the international community.

articles.title: Samsung’s New Wi-Fi Speaker Has Big Monolith Energy - Gizmodo
articles.description: Playing the theme to '2001: A Space Odyssey' on this thing might feel a little too on-the-nose.

articles.title: Transcript from Charlie Kirk shooting suspect hearing for must be released, judge orders - PBS
articles.description: State District Judge Tony Graf said Monday the transcript must be posted on the court docket by the end of the day.

articles.title: Chappell Roan Removes Brigitte Bardot Tribute After Learning About ‘All That Insane Shit’ - Rolling Stone
articles.description: Chappell Roan removed her tribute to Brigitte Bardot after learning about the French icon's history of controversial statements.
